ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish

comments: Flexibility from professor and TA in terms of driving discussion sessions, presentations, final paper etc.
The readings were hit or miss. Some gems were in there however, especially if you are interested in soils/land use management

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: I would've liked to see more students in the class and gain from a wider set of perspectives.
The discussions were often not very good.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: It was great. Professor and TA were available anytime to answer questions. I mostly contacted the TA.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I took this class because I am generally interested in the subject matter, but it is not a requirement per se.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes, I learned a lot from the course.
I had not really formulated any expectations before going in so this is a difficult question to answer.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes, I got out of it what I put into. The readings can be useful.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: This is not a pamper-the-students class. If you you are interested in the subject you can get some good stuff out of it, but this is BY NO MEANS an intro to soils class. I would recommend students have a little bit of background going into this. This background could be as little as an informal interest in soils if someone is generally well read, but I think an intro soil class before this one might be ideal.
It helps to take an introductory course on soil science. There is not much of a science background in the class, but the material is practical and interesting.
